brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the steps to resolving DNS addresses.

Step 1. A PC DNS client is connected to a DNS server via a network cloud.
Step 2. PC browser window is shown with http://www.cisco.com entered. The text box states: "The name is easy for people to use."
Step 3. The web server name www.cisco.com is sent to the DNS server.
Step 4. The DNS server looks up the name www.cisco.com and matches it to IP address 198.133.219.25. The conversation bubbles state: "The DNS server matches the human address with the numeric address" and "The devices use numbers."
Step 5. The IP address 198.133.219.25 is returned back to the client for use in making requests of the server.
Step 6. A human legible name is resolved to its numeric network device address, 198.133.219.25, by the DNS protocol.
